intro: Enantia chlorantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
